meaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical>, once stopped by a <radical>belt</radical>, will begin to <kanji>stagnate</kanji>. This belt is a belt of water resistance, so the belt stops the tsunami. The belt has caused the tsunami to stagnate.
readingMnemonic: While you watch the tsunami <kanji>stagnate</kanji>, you get ready for work. While you were watching this whole thing happening, you were tying your <reading>tie</reading> (たい). Once the tsunami stagnated, you were all done tying your tie. And since the tsunami is no longer a threat, you’re ready to go to work.
